item.title: Using the Asus AC56 in Linux
item.author: sumitros@gmail.com (Sumitro Bhaumik)
item.description: This USB Wifi dongle was bought by our lab. But when I finally got it in my hands, I saw that the driver CD was missing. So I decided to hunt for the driver from the interwebz. This is my journey. Download the driver from this link. Download it as a ZIP Unzip the contents and go inside the directory Get all essentials for make sudo apt install linux-headers-generic build-essential Make and install
